intro: Athamanta capensis, commonly known as the Cape athamanta, is a perennial herb native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features linear, grass-like leaves. Its flowering period occurs in spring, producing small, yellowish to brownish flowers arranged in a cluster. Athamanta capensis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native region.
